title: Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park: Calendar
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar            Calendar       Search Events Calendar (below) for all our seasonal listings.  Download the 2016 Programs in the Park.           Keyword       By Date     Start Date      End Date          Search         Upcoming Events    Showing 20 results    Show ALL instances of recurring events   RSS Feed      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park A Legacy of Stewardship: Introductory Tour to the Park and Mansion      Time: 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM,2:00 PM to 3:00 PM Location: Carriage Barn Visitor Center Fees: Fee; Tour size is limited; Reservations recommended     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/31/2016 to 10/31/2016 One-hour long ranger-led tours of the Mansion and grounds are offered daily throughout the season.  View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Centennial Visions Sculpture Exhibition      Location: Carriage Barn Visitor Center Fees: Free      Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 06/04/2016 to 08/24/2016 You’ll find more than 20 sculptures from different artists installed around the park, outdoors and in the Carriage Barn Visitor Center. The works exhibited illustrate our Centennial theme of “Find Your Park”.  Enjoy the harmony of art and nature.  View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Hidden Spaces Unique Places      Time: 1:00 PM to 2:30 PM Location: Carriage Barn Visitor Center Fees: $8.00; Reservations are recommended     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly  from 06/05/2016 to 10/30/2016 90-minute sneak-peek behind the scenes in the Mansion, Belvedere and Bungalow. Some uphill walking.  View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Mansion Glimpse      Time: 11:00 AM to 11:30 AM,12:00 PM to 12:30 PM,3:00 PM to 3:30 PM Location: Mansion Front Porch Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly  from 06/05/2016 to 10/30/2016 What can a person's belongings tell us about their life? You're invited to shape this tour by selecting the objects the ranger will discuss to reveal the stories of the families who once lived here. View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Photography by Stephen Lias Exhibition      Location: May 28-Aug 20 Exhibition:Carriage Barn Visitor Center ; Aug 20 4pm "Composing Wilderness; Aug 21 2pm Concert @ Saint-Gaudens Natl Historic Site Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/28/2016 to 08/20/2016 Inspired by his passion for wilderness, composer Stephen Lias has produced a series of musical works about the national parks of the US.  His photography is exhibited in conjunction with the concert premier of a new work. View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Sunday Salon: An invitation to engage with current issues      Time: 3:30 PM to 5:00 PM Location: Carriage Barn Visitor Center Fees: $8     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly  from 06/05/2016 to 10/30/2016 Enjoy a stimulating 90-minute conversation in the mansion parlor about a timely topic. Come ready to share your perspective!  View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park The Nature of Your Park      Time: 10:00 AM Location: Carriage Barn Visitor Center  Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly & Every Monday Weekly & Every Wednesday Weekly & Every Thursday Weekly & Every Friday Weekly & Every Saturday Weekly  from 06/01/2016 to 10/31/2016 Enjoy a nature topic of the day.  Ask at our Visitor Center desks or call 802 457 3368, ext 222 for daily topic and meeting place. You're invited to shape this tour by selecting the objects the ranger will discuss to reveal the stories of the families who once lived here.  View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Fallout: Cold War Conflict and Conservation      Time: 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM Location: Carriage Barn Visitor Center Fees: $8.00 Reservations recommended     Tuesday, August 16, 2016 Every Tuesday Weekly & Every Friday Weekly  from 05/31/2016 to 10/28/2016 Consider how the Cold War influenced environmental awareness. One hour tour visits 1960s-era fallout shelter View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Ranger-Led Summer Junior Ranger Adventures       Location: Carriage Barn Visitor Center Fees: Free     Tuesday, August 16, 2016 Every Tuesday Weekly & Every Saturday Weekly  from 06/28/2016 to 08/23/2016 For ages 6-12 years accompanied by an adult. Join a ranger for exciting hands-on explorations of Nature and Parks. This version of the program follows the them of life in a log. View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Gardener's Delight      Location: Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller NHP & Billings Farm & Museum     Wednesday, August 17, 2016 Every Wednesday Weekly  from 08/03/2016 to 08/31/2016 Combine a Gardens in Bloom program at the National Park with an Heirloom Gardens Tour at Billings Farm & Museum. Explore the layers of landscape history. View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Behind the Scenes: Service then and now      Time: 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM Location: Carriage Barn Visitor Center Fees: $8     Thursday, August 18, 2016 Every Thursday Weekly  from 06/02/2016 to 10/27/2016 Pass through the closed doors on the Mansion stairs into service wing.  View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Educators' Workshop      Time: 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM Location: Carriage Barn Visitor Center Fees: Free     Friday, August 19, 2016 Explore all that the National Park and Billings Farm & Museum have to offer. The day will be full of fun activities and will highlight programs developed by teachers, for teachers.  View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Billings Women: A conservation legacy of their own      Time: 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM Location: Carriage Barn Visitor Center Fees: $8 adults      Saturday, August 20, 2016 Every Saturday Weekly  from 06/04/2016 to 10/29/2016 Discover how women influenced the development of the Billings Estate and the National Park.  View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Boots to Boats - Appalachian Trails & Tales      Time: 9:30 AM to 12:30 PM Location: Carriage Barn Visitor Center Fees: Registration required, free     Saturday, August 20, 2016 Eight ranger-led hikes on the Appalachian Trail. *Hikes include activities and stories. They vary from 1.5 to 3 hours plus travel time to trailheads. 12 person limit.  View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Composing Wilderness - Concert Premier by Stephen Lias      Time: 4:00 PM Location: Carriage Barn Visitor Center Fees: Free     Saturday, August 20, 2016 Composing Wilderness, an audio-visual presentation by the artist on Saturday August 20, 4pm at the Carriage Barn Visitor Center, Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller NHP View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Founder's Day: American Landscape Painting and National Parks      Time: 6:30 PM Location: Carriage Barn Visitor Center Fees: Free     Thursday, August 25, 2016 Celebrate the 100th birthday of the National Park Service with an inspirational talk about the synergy between art and the American conservation movement. Presented by our 2016 Artist-in-Residence Joan Hoffman.  View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Centennial Celebration: 100th Anniversary Party      Time: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM Location: Carriage Barn Visitor Center Fees: Free     Saturday, August 27, 2016 Enjoy family fun with games, children’s art workshops with our Artist-in-Residence, and special ranger-led tours. The Mansion will be open for walk-throughs. Bring a picnic and enjoy the gardens in full bloom.  View Details      Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park Boots and Breath: Yoga Hikes      Location: On the Appalachian Trail      Saturday, September 10, 2016 Enjoy a walking meditation through hills and forest, integrating yoga poses with the surrounding landscape. View Details             ____________________________________________________________________ GROUPS of 10 or more - By Request Only        NPS Photo  Conservation Chronicles From Native Americans to early European settlers, to land trusts, national parks, and wilderness areas, conservation thought and practice has taken many forms in North America over the past four centuries.Using words, images, and films of the past, explore the attitudes and actions that have shaped our relationship with the land we call the United States in this multimedia presentation.  Available by request only for groups of 10 or more.         The Life and Times of George Perkins Marsh Born in 1801 in Woodstock, Vermont, George Perkins Marsh is considered a pioneering conservationist who helped shape the future of land use on a global scale.His experience in the Vermont forests in his formative years, combined with his worldwide travel and multiple career choices culminated in his ground breaking book "Man & Nature" printed in 1864.This presentation will touch on the times he worked in and the milestones in his life that led him to be called the father of the American conservation movement. Available by request only for groups of 10 or more.
